title: Who helps the spread of Christianity during the Middle Age? - Quora

response.answer_text: Mostly priests and monks. And especially monks from places that we now know as England, Scotland , Ireland, France, Italy and in some parts Germany. During the Early Middle Age and the reign of the Merovingians the monks from the British Isles as well as the Pope via his emissaries. Like Wilbrord, Boniface, Columbanus and their students Gaius, Frimino, Raihenau, Fridolin and many more. Also the Order of Saint Benedict had a large part in the spread of Christianity in the west during the Early Middle Ages. In the east it is notable to mention the Saint brothers Cyril and Metodius. And during the Late Middle Age the French wear dominant in the spread of Christianity as well as the Pope. In France there were a lot of new monasteries like Saint-Denis, Masnedy, Stavelot, Peron and similar who wear built in the 7 or 8 century but established their influence later. Also it is worth mentioning orders like the Order of Saint Augustine, The second Order of Francise Assise, Order of Friars Minor and the Dominican Order. The Saints who established these orders and their students wear the ones who helped the spread of Christianity. And also the Popes had a large part in the spread of Christianity, but there were a lot of them.
